Sentencas: Several proton conductive ceramic oxides are evaluated for potential application in ceramic-NiO composite anodes for proton-conducting La0.99Ca0.01NbO4 (LNO) electrolyte-based fuel cells.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with proton-conducting La0.99Ca0.01NbO4 electrolyte

Sentencas: Chemical compatibility tests show that most of the existing proton-conducting oxides are unfavorable for application in LNO electrolyte-based fuel cells because of undesirable reactions at high temperatures.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with proton-conducting La0.99Ca0.01NbO4 electrolyte

Sentencas: Further considering the chemical compatibility with NiO and the ability to promote the densification of the deposited LNO electrolyte, LNO-NiO composite anode proves to be the only suitable anode candidate.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with proton-conducting La0.99Ca0.01NbO4 electrolyte

Sentencas: With humidified hydrogen (similar to 3% H2O) as the fuel and static air as the oxidant, fuel cells based on LNO electrolyte film deposited on LNO-NiO anodes show a peak power density of 24 mW cm(-2) at 750 degrees C, this value being one of the largest ever reported for LNO-based cells.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with proton-conducting La0.99Ca0.01NbO4 electrolyte

Sentencas: Further investigation reveals that the polarization resistance of the cell is the major contribution to the total cell resistance, limiting the overall cell performance.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with proton-conducting La0.99Ca0.01NbO4 electrolyte
